author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Researchers have created nanofibers made from white flour starch, averaging just 370 nanometers thick—roughly two-hundredths the width of a human hair. - it's the world's tiniest pasta. These biodegradable nanofibers are being explored for advanced medical applications, such as bandages. 

Source Article: https://pubs.rsc.org/en/content/articlelanding/2024/na/d4na00601a 

#nanotechnology #biodegradable #medicine #breakthrough #shorts
